lead_paragraph: Shawn Johnson won the United States gymnastics championships handily last night in San Jose, Calif. Her score of 123.650 was 3.450 points ahead of the runner-up, Shayla Worley. Johnson is sure to be a favorite at next month’s world championships in Stuttgart, Germany. The world team also includes Nastia Liukin, Alicia Sacramone, Samantha Peszek, Ivana Hong and Bridget Sloan. Jana Bieger, the world silver medalist, had difficulties and was left off the squad.
